articles.headline: Trump Attends G-7 with Defiance, Proposing to Readmit Russia
articles.snippet: President Trump’s proposal on Russia further stirred tension with America’s allies over trade, Iran and the president’s sharp-edged foreign policy.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s proposal on Russia further stirred tension with America’s allies over trade, Iran and the president’s sharp-edged foreign policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: LA MALBAIE, Quebec — President Trump aggressively confronted America’s closest allies on Friday as they convened their annual summit meeting, calling for Russia’s readmission to the Group of 7 nations and refusing to ease his assault on the global trading system.

articles.headline: China’s ZTE, Saved by U.S., Has a Checkered Past and Shaky Future
articles.snippet: As the telecom company expanded internationally, it was trailed by corruption accusations. Then it got in trouble with Washington over its Iran business.
articles.abstract: As the telecom company expanded internationally, it was trailed by corruption accusations. Then it got in trouble with Washington over its Iran business.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The Chinese electronics maker ZTE has survived its brush with death. Now it has to figure out how to stay in business.

articles.headline: Mueller Adds Obstruction Charge on Manafort and Indicts His Right-Hand Man
articles.snippet: Paul Manafort’s longtime associate, Konstantin V. Kilimnik, is suspected of having ties to Russian intelligence. Prosecutors say the two men tried to tamper with witnesses.
articles.abstract: Paul Manafort’s longtime associate, Konstantin V. Kilimnik, is suspected of having ties to Russian intelligence. Prosecutors say the two men tried to tamper with witnesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After months of oblique references to an unnamed Russian associate of Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, the special counsel identified the associate on Friday and charged both men with obstruction of justice.

articles.headline: Pixar Co-Founder to Leave Disney After ‘Missteps’
articles.snippet: John Lasseter had been on leave since November, citing what he called “missteps” that made employees feel uncomfortable. He will be a consultant for Disney until the end of the year.
articles.abstract: John Lasseter had been on leave since November, citing what he called “missteps” that made employees feel uncomfortable. He will be a consultant for Disney until the end of the year.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — John Lasseter, the animation titan who has been on leave from the Walt Disney Company following complaints about unwanted workplace hugging, will not return to the conglomerate.

articles.headline: Mark Zuckerberg, Elon Musk and the Feud Over Killer Robots
articles.snippet: As the tech moguls disagree over the risks presented by something that doesn’t exist yet, all of Silicon Valley is learning about unintended consequences of A.I.
articles.abstract: As the tech moguls disagree over the risks presented by something that doesn’t exist yet, all of Silicon Valley is learning about unintended consequences of A.I.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Mark Zuckerberg thought his fellow Silicon Valley billionaire Elon Musk was behaving like an alarmist.

articles.headline: Trump’s Blasts Upend G-7, Alienating Oldest Allies
articles.snippet: With his America First agenda, President Trump has driven a wedge between the United States and its allies, ceding leadership and its seat at the table.
articles.abstract: With his America First agenda, President Trump has driven a wedge between the United States and its allies, ceding leadership and its seat at the table.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Shortly before leaving the annual meeting of major world powers on Saturday, President Trump boasted that it had been “tremendously successful” and that on a scale of 0 to 10, “the relationship is a 10.”
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Trump Refuses to Sign G-7 Statement and Calls Trudeau ‘Weak’
articles.snippet: In a remarkable pair of acrimony-laced tweets, Mr. Trump threatened to escalate his trade war and derided Canada’s prime minister as “very dishonest.”
articles.abstract: In a remarkable pair of acrimony-laced tweets, Mr. Trump threatened to escalate his trade war and derided Canada’s prime minister as “very dishonest.”
articles.lead_paragraph: QUEBEC CITY — President Trump upended two days of global economic diplomacy late Saturday, refusing to sign a joint statement with America’s allies, threatening to escalate his trade war on the country’s neighbors and deriding Canada’s prime minister as “very dishonest and weak.”
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Catherine Porter

articles.headline: Corruption Gutted South Africa’s Tax Agency. Now the Nation Is Paying the Price.
articles.snippet: Taxes are the lifeblood of any nation, but South Africa’s leaders resisted paying their own, former officials say. Now taxpayers are closing their wallets, too.
articles.abstract: Taxes are the lifeblood of any nation, but South Africa’s leaders resisted paying their own, former officials say. Now taxpayers are closing their wallets, too.
articles.lead_paragraph: PRETORIA, South Africa — The nation’s tax chief steeled himself. Chiding and pleading with President Jacob Zuma to get him to file his taxes — much less pay the full amount — was always an excruciating task.
articles.byline: By Selam Gebrekidan and Norimitsu Onishi

articles.headline: AT&T-Time Warner Ruling Has Dealmakers Bracing
articles.snippet: A judge is expected to release an opinion about the merger of AT&T and Time Warner on Tuesday. The decision could transform the path of many blockbuster deals in an instant.
articles.abstract: A judge is expected to release an opinion about the merger of AT&T and Time Warner on Tuesday. The decision could transform the path of many blockbuster deals in an instant.
articles.lead_paragraph: Disney’s offer to buy 21st Century Fox. CVS’s bid for Aetna. T-Mobile’s proposed merger with Sprint.
articles.byline: By Cecilia Kang, Brooks Barnes and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Mitt Romney Wants In Again. There Is One Catch.
articles.snippet: His wife said they were done with campaigns. But after two high-profile losses on the national stage, a Senate bid was too good to pass up, even if it means dealing with Donald Trump.
articles.abstract: His wife said they were done with campaigns. But after two high-profile losses on the national stage, a Senate bid was too good to pass up, even if it means dealing with Donald Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: COTTONWOOD HEIGHTS, Utah — Mitt Romney never could resist a race.

articles.headline: Tax Havens Blunt Impact of Corporate Tax Cut, Economists Say
articles.snippet: The Trump administration’s corporate tax cuts are unlikely to have their promised effect on job creation, a trio of prominent economists has concluded.
articles.abstract: The Trump administration’s corporate tax cuts are unlikely to have their promised effect on job creation, a trio of prominent economists has concluded.
articles.lead_paragraph: The new corporate tax cuts are unlikely to stimulate the level of job creation and wage growth that the Trump administration has promised, a trio of prominent economists has concluded, because high tax rates were not pushing much investment out of the United States in the first place.

articles.headline: ZTE’s Near-Collapse May Be China’s Sputnik Moment
articles.snippet: The tech giant’s experience made many people in China see how far the country still has to go. “We realized that China’s prosperity was built on sand.”
articles.abstract: The tech giant’s experience made many people in China see how far the country still has to go. “We realized that China’s prosperity was built on sand.”
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Once derided as a technology backwater and copycat, China is justifiably proud of its technology boom. Its people zip around the country on high-speed trains. They can buy, and pay for, just about anything with their smartphones. For Chinese traveling abroad, the rest of the world can seem slow and antiquated.

articles.headline: In Targeting Times Reporter, Justice Dept. Backs Trump’s Anti-Press Rhetoric
articles.snippet: A ratcheting up of tensions between the media and government, continuing a crackdown on leaks that ramped up in the Obama years.
articles.abstract: A ratcheting up of tensions between the media and government, continuing a crackdown on leaks that ramped up in the Obama years.
articles.lead_paragraph: Inside a wood-and-leather conference room at the Department of Justice in Washington, a group of veteran journalists gathered last Wednesday to hear the deputy attorney general, Rod J. Rosenstein, review the government’s policies on obtaining information from reporters.

articles.headline: Escalating Clash With Canada, Trump Is Isolated Before North Korea Meeting
articles.snippet: Whether Kim Jong-un sees President Trump’s combative approach as a sign of strength or weakness, the rupture with allies was sure to shadow the session between the two in Singapore on Tuesday.
articles.abstract: Whether Kim Jong-un sees President Trump’s combative approach as a sign of strength or weakness, the rupture with allies was sure to shadow the session between the two in Singapore on Tuesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump escalated a bitter clash with some of America’s closest allies on Sunday, lashing out through his advisers at Canada’s prime minister in unusually personal terms and leaving himself with a diplomatic crisis as he arrived in Asia to negotiate a nuclear agreement with North Korea.

articles.headline: Trump Upends Global Trade Order Built by U.S.
articles.snippet: The president’s searing criticisms of trade left allies in Canada, Japan and Europe wary of upsetting a global trade order but unwilling to back down.
articles.abstract: The president’s searing criticisms of trade left allies in Canada, Japan and Europe wary of upsetting a global trade order but unwilling to back down.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At the rockiest annual meeting of major Western powers in decades, President Trump criticized the tariffs imposed on American goods as “ridiculous and unacceptable” and vowed to put an end to being “like a piggy bank that everybody is robbing.”

articles.headline: For All His Deals, Trump Has Never Faced an Adversary Like Kim Jong-un
articles.snippet: How President Trump and Mr. Kim — both volatile, thin-skinned and eager never to show weakness — will interact with each other is the great mystery of the summit meeting.
articles.abstract: How President Trump and Mr. Kim — both volatile, thin-skinned and eager never to show weakness — will interact with each other is the great mystery of the summit meeting.
articles.lead_paragraph: SINGAPORE — President Trump has imagined himself at the center of high-stakes nuclear negotiations since at least the mid-1980s, when he tried, unsuccessfully, to persuade the Reagan administration that it needed a New York real estate deal maker to lead arms-control talks with the Soviet Union.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Choe Sang-Hun

articles.headline: Mexico Could Press Bribery Charges. It Just Hasn’t.
articles.snippet: The government has evidence to go after officials tied to one of the biggest scandals in Latin America, critics say, but it is protecting the governing party.
articles.abstract: The government has evidence to go after officials tied to one of the biggest scandals in Latin America, critics say, but it is protecting the governing party.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Mexico’s government has enough evidence to charge officials connected to one of the biggest corruption scandals in Latin American history. But it is refusing to bring charges because they might hurt the governing party ahead of presidential elections, according to three people with direct knowledge of the case.

articles.headline: Democratic Women Are Running for Governor. Men and Money Stand in Their Way.
articles.snippet: Female Democrats in Nevada and Maine, which vote Tuesday, and other states face male opponents who have deep coffers, establishment support and, in some cases, less experience.
articles.abstract: Female Democrats in Nevada and Maine, which vote Tuesday, and other states face male opponents who have deep coffers, establishment support and, in some cases, less experience.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — When Chris Giunchigliani told former Senator Harry Reid about her plans to run for governor of Nevada in 2018, he candidly told her that he thought her opponent, Steve Sisolak, would make a stronger candidate, Ms. Giunchigliani recently recalled.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Supreme Court Upholds Ohio’s Purge of Voting Rolls
articles.snippet: The case was the latest battle in a partisan war over how far states can go in imposing all kinds of voting restrictions, including cutbacks on early voting and tough voter ID laws.
articles.abstract: The case was the latest battle in a partisan war over how far states can go in imposing all kinds of voting restrictions, including cutbacks on early voting and tough voter ID laws.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Monday upheld Ohio’s aggressive efforts to purge its voting rolls, siding with Republicans in the latest partisan battle over how far states can go in imposing restrictions on voting.

articles.headline: Amazon Studios’ New Boss Is Reshaping Its Strategy. Step One: Lure New Talent.
articles.snippet: Jennifer Salke, the new head of the tech giant’s TV and movie division, is letting Hollywood know that the door is open for creative talent to find a home at Amazon.
articles.abstract: Jennifer Salke, the new head of the tech giant’s TV and movie division, is letting Hollywood know that the door is open for creative talent to find a home at Amazon.
articles.lead_paragraph: CULVER CITY, Calif. — Jennifer Salke has been the head of Amazon’s television and movie division for four months. Her sunny corner office at Culver Studios, a historic movie lot that now serves as Amazon’s entertainment headquarters, has not yet been fully put together. She is still getting to know some staff members in the film department.
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes and John Koblin
